commitResults.messageBody: Renamed Chatbot from Duke to Blitz.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add user input functionality in Blitz.java
commitResults.messageBody: Accepts user input and echos input. Terminates when user types "bye" (case insensitive)

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Add user input functionality in Blitz.java"
commitResults.messageBody: This reverts commit 78f52167dd513642d0fcc98d5035c4982e69ee28.

commitResults.messageTitle: bug fix: code used to still echo "bye" before printing "till we meet again..."
commitResults.messageBody: Changed the while loop condition. Trim trailing white space before checking
Tracks user input history and prints it in list format when user inputs "list" (case insensitive)

Strings stored in an array list

By encapsulating information in Task object we do not have to create multiple array lists to store information for same Task instance

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functions to abstract logic within while loop
commitResults.messageBody:
While loop used to handle all the logic checking

Flow is less clear when the logic is being handled within main function.  After the change main is more readable

commitResults.messageTitle: Add mark and unmark feature for tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Tasks can now be marked as completed or uncompleted. Error checking present for when an non-integer input is given

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug fix: ignore when user inputs an empty line
commitResults.messageBody:
If user types only spaces or returns immediately, that is taken as an entry

Users can accidentally press enter, we do not want to record empty lines as a valid task

All tasks were considered to be the same type

User can input different kinds of tasks with different information

Creation of new Task() handled in main

Makes code main() more tidy. Factory method can determine the correct
task subclass based on the entire description

commitResults.messageTitle: Add check for invalid task type
commitResults.messageBody:
With task subclasses users can potentially key in invalid task types.
Factory method returns null when invalid type is given.

commitResults.messageTitle: Task toString(): remove the task type from toString
commitResults.messageBody:
Printed the task type at the start before description

Task type is now represented by the letter on the extreme left
test output when 1 task of each type is added
Increases readability of exception handling

Invalid task exception was caught when factory method returns null

Factory method explicitly throws an InvalidTaskException.
Factory method throws exception when task type is not followed by
description. Improves readability of code and exception handle is more
appropriate than if-else blocks in this scenario
User can delete a task, regardless of whether it is completed
Clearer management for different types of tasks. Improves readability

All the methods were static, only accommodating for 1 instance of Blitz

Changed implementation to allow multiple instances of chatbot by making
it non-static. Removed logic from main, moved to start()

inputHistory passed as arguments into multiple functions

Every instance has its own history, methods reference that directly

inputHistory passed as arguments into multiple functions

Every instance has its own history, methods reference that directly

commitResults.messageTitle: Add save and load feature for task persistence
commitResults.messageBody:
- Program data was lost upon termination.
- No functionality existed to save tasks to disk or load them on startup.

Lets,
- Implement reading from blitz.txt on program startup to load tasks.
- Implement writing to blitz.txt when the program terminates to save
tasks.
- Ensure that program data persists after exiting, allowing tasks to be
retained across sessions.

Dates are taken as strings

Lets,
- Specify a date format for clients to follow and store them as LocalDate
and LocalTime instances
- Display date and time in different formats
- Allow for easy editing of task time and date (feature not implemented
yet)

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Gradle for automating build tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
- Integrated Gradle into the project to streamline build processes.
- Set up basic Gradle tasks for checkstyle, testing, and running the
application.
- Added dependencies and configurations to automate project workflows.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit test cases for Blitz and Task classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added tests for `actionBasedOnInput` method in `Blitz` class to handle
various input scenarios including empty input, invalid indexes, and
non-numeric values.

- Added tests for `createTask` method in `Task` class to validate
exception handling for empty descriptions

* branch-level-8:
  Add support for LocalDate & LocalTime

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/Task.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Storage, TaskList, Parser, Ui classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Logic mostly handled by Task and Blitz classes

Lets,
- Implement Storage class to handle data persistence (read/write to
blitz.txt)
- Add Parser class to process and understand user commands
- Creat TaskList class to manage tasks (add, delete, mark/unmark tasks)
- Introduce UI class to handle user interaction and console output
- Improve overall design by separating concerns and modularizing code
- Make the code easier to scale to different task types

* add-gradle-support:
  build.gradle: Prevent generating a second JAR file
  Bump gradle and lib version
  Add Gradle support

commitResults.messageTitle: Update build.grade set mainClass as Blitz.java

commitResults.messageBody:

  Add Gradle for automating build tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Add unit test for command handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Unit test based on old commit (before MoreOOP)

- Update unit test due to change in implementation

User could not filter tasks by description

Lets,
- allow users to find tasks by searching for keywords in description

User had to input time with a colon

Lets,
- Allow user to just type in 24 hour format (e.g. 1800)

- Add docs to AddTaskCommand, DeleteCommand, ExitCommand, ListCommand,
MarkCommand, UnmarkCommand, Parser, Task, TaskList, Deadline, Event,
Todo
- Format files to adhere to course coding style conventions

Refactor Blitz from CLI to GUI using JavaFX
- Implement initial GUI layout while retaining CLI functionality
- Add JavaFX components to replicate existing command-line interactions
- Maintain core features and user flow for a smooth transition to GUI
- Update event handling and user input/output processing for GUI-based
interactions

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert statements to improve code validation
commitResults.messageBody:
- Inserted assert statements to verify assumptions and ensure proper
functioning of key components.
- These checks will help catch potential issues early during development
and debugging.
- Ensures that input values and internal states are valid before
proceeding with execution.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to reduce magic strings and improve method readability
commitResults.messageBody:
- Moved all magic strings to its own class ErrorMessageHandler, improve
maintainability and reduce potential errors
- Refactored long to smaller, more manageable functions
- Removed unused variables and imports

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to use Java Streams
commitResults.messageBody: - Improve efficiency be introducing lazy operations
Add assert statements to improve code validation

Refactor code to reduce magic strings and improve method readability
Refactor code to use Java Streams

- Implemented tagging functionality for tasks including todos, events,
and deadlines.
- Users can now add tags using the `-t` flag followed by tags.
- Updated task input commands to support optional tags for better
task organization.
- Users can also filter by tags using `find -t (tag names)`
- Example commands for adding tags:
  - `todo math hw -t urgent difficult`
  - `find -t urgent` to filter tasks by tags.

* branch-Tagging:
  Add tagging feature to tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: bug fix: prevent default empty string tag from being added when no tags are specified
commitResults.messageBody:
Empty string tag ("") added by default even when no tags were provided.

Lets:
Ensure tags are only added when specified by the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add background colours, resizable window, and circular profile pics
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added background color to the speech bubbles for better visual appeal
- Made the application window resizable to improve user experience
- Updated icons to have a circular shape for a modern look

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug Fix: Correctly identify and retain existing user tags during data import
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the parser could only identify tags from user input.

Lets,
- Allows tags to be identified and retained when data is imported.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Add Javadocs for multiple classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Improved clarity by including descriptions for public methods,
constructors, and fields

commitResults.messageTitle: bug fix: Ensure mark/unmark operations persist to storage
commitResults.messageBody:
mark/unmark operations did not write to storage,
causing changes to task status to be non-persistent.

- Call `writeToStorage()` after every mark/unmark operation to ensure
task status is properly updated and saved.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Update README with detailed usage instructions and UI image
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added detailed instructions for using Blitz, including adding todos,
deadlines, and events.
- Described how to use tags and filter tasks by description or tags.
- Included examples for marking tasks as done/undone and deleting tasks.
- Updated exit instructions and clarified data-saving behavior.
- Added a UI image to enhance user understanding.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Remove unnecessary print statements and add Javadocs
commitResults.messageBody:
- Removed redundant print statements to clean up the codebase.
- Added Javadocs to improve code documentation and maintainability for
one file.
- set width of image to 300px
- set image width to 300px using HTML

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Abstracted switch statement bodies into individual methods
commitResults.messageBody:
- Moved the logic for handling 'todo', 'event', and 'deadline' from the
switch statement in `dataInputToUserInput` into their own methods
(`todoInputToUserInput`, `eventInputToUserInput`,
`deadlineInputToUserInput`).
- Improved code readability and maintainability by encapsulating each
task type's conversion logic in dedicated methods.
- This change makes it easier to add or modify task type parsing
logic in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Chore: Refactor code to adhere to course checkstyle
commitResults.messageBody:
- Updated code formatting, spacing, and import order to meet the course
checkstyle requirements.
- Ensured compliance with all specified style guidelines to maintain
code quality and uniformity.

commitResults.messageBody:

- Updated existing test cases for creating tasks without descriptions
and tasks with invalid dates or task types.
- Ensured proper coverage for edge cases in task creation scenarios.
